tacticulous.game.domain

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • tacticulous.game.domain.Player

  • public class Player
extends Object
    Contains player-specific data, unit lists in particular.
    Author:
    O

      • newRoundUnitReset

        public void newRoundUnitReset()
        New round initialization. Resets all unit actions.
        See Also:
        Unit.newRound()

      • isDoneForTheRound

        public boolean isDoneForTheRound()
        Goes through all the player's units and checks if any have not moved or attacked.
        Returns:
        true if no units have move or attack actions remaining, false otherwise.

      • getUnits

        public TacList<Unit> getUnits()

      • getFirstUnitWithActions

        public Unit getFirstUnitWithActions()
        Finds the first unit in the unit list with unused move or attack action.
        Returns:
        null if no units have actions remaining.

      • isAi

        public boolean isAi()
        Checks if player is controlled by an AI.
        Returns:
        true if player is AI controlled.

      • setAI

        public void setAI(ArtificialIntelligence ai)
        ROBOT APOCALYPSE (apocalypse not yet fully implemented). Makes the player AI-controlled.
        Parameters:
        ai - Artifical Intelligence of ROBOT APOCALYPSE. Null will toggle the ai off.

      • quickStartUnits

        public void quickStartUnits(int multiplier)
        Adds a set of three units to the player's unit list for quickstart games and some tests.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - how many sets of three units are created

      • addUnit

        public void addUnit(Unit unit)
        Adds unit to unit list.

      • kill

        public void kill(Unit unit)
        Removes a destroyed unit from unit lists.
        Parameters:
        unit -

      • leaderIsDead

        public boolean leaderIsDead()
        Checks if player's leader unit is dead (not in unit list.)
        Returns:
        false if leader is in unit list.
